t: This*p know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.
For*p men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,
Without*p natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,
Traitors,*p heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;
Having*p a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.
For*p of this sort are they which creep into houses, and lead captive silly women laden with sins, led away with divers lusts,
Ever*p learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
Now*p as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds, reprobate concerning the faith.
But*p they shall proceed no further: for their folly shall be manifest unto all men, as theirs also was.
But*p thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, charity, patience,
Persecutions,*p afflictions, which came unto me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra; what persecutions I endured: but out of them all the Lord delivered me.
Yea,*p and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.
But*p evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived.
But*p continue thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learned them;
And*p that from a child thou hast known the holy scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.
All*p scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:
That*p the man of God may be perfect, thoroughly furnished unto all good works.
